Welcome to Heart Rate Monitor’s documentation!¶

processECG.subtractDC(volt)¶

Subtracts the average of an array from all the values in the array.

This function subtracts off the DC offset within the ECG data.

Parameters:volt (list) – List of voltages containing floats
Returns:List with DC average subtracted
Return type:subvolt (list)
processECG.movingAverage(t, volts, window)¶

Reduces noise by applying a moving average window.

Parameters:
  • t (list) – List of ECG time floats
  • volts (list) – List of ECG voltage floats
  • window (int) – Size of moving average window
Returns:

List of moving average voltage floats
Return type:

lengthenedavg (list)
readCSV.readCsv(name)¶

Reads ECG data from .csv.

This function extracts ECG data from a csv and stores it in the appropriate lists.

:param : name (string): .csv filename

Returns:list containing time data from csv file v (list): list containing voltage data from csv file
Return type:t (list)
readCSV.recondtiontv(bottombnd, upperbnd, t, v)¶
peakDetection.peakDetect(t, v)¶

Detects R wave peaks from processed ECG data.

This function identifies R wave peaks using the continuous wavelet transform

Parameters:
  • t (list) – List of ECG time floats
  • v (list) – List of processed ECG voltage floats.
Returns:

List of integer indices corresponding to peaks

in input lists.
Return type:

peakind (list)
readCSV.recondtiontv(bottombnd, upperbnd, t, v)
extVolt.extremeVolt(volts)¶

Determines the min and max of a list.

This function determines the min and max voltages of an ECG data set.

Parameters:volts (list) – List of voltages containing floats
Returns:minimum ECG voltage max (float): maximum ECG voltage
Return type:min (float)
hrcalc.hrCalc(peakind, t)¶

Determines the average HR over a specified interval.

This function determines average number of beats/minute over a specified interval of ECG data.

Parameters:
  • peakind (list) – List of indices corresponding to peaks of the R wave
  • t (list) – List of ECG time floats
Returns:

Average number of beats/minute
Return type:

avghr (float)
timeDuration.timeDuration(times)¶

Subtracts the first element of a list from the last.

This function determines the duration of time that the ECG data was taken.

Parameters:
  • times (list) – List containing floats corresponding to the time of
  • ECG voltage data point (each) –
Returns:

the length of time the ECG data was taken
Return type:

duration (float)
writetoJson.writetoJson(csvfile, meanhr, voltextremes, duration, beatnum, heartbeattimes)¶

Writes JSON file with hrm results

This function writes the calculated hr parameters to a JSON file with same name as the data.

:param : csvfile (string): Name of data file :param : meanhr (float): Calculated mean hr in interval :param : voltextremes (tuple): Tuple of floats corresponding to voltage extrema :param : duration (float): Time duration of data :param : beatnum (int): Number of beats detected in ECG data :param : heartbeattimes (list): List time floats of detected R wave peaks

Returns:
